sentences: Kas sa meeldid mulle? See on sinu valik.
context: The Estonian word 'sinu' is a possessive pronoun that means 'your' in English. It indicates possession or belonging to the person being addressed (second person singular). In Estonian, possessive pronouns agree with the noun they modify in case and number. The word 'sinu' specifically belongs to the second person singular form, used when speaking to one person informally.
